Adult male.description: Adult male Broad-tailed Hummingbirds lack the adult male Anna's red crown.

Female/immature.description: Female/immature Broad-tailed Hummingbirds have cinnamon-washed flanks, unlike the grayish green flanks of Anna's Hummingbirds.

Adult male.description: Black-chinned Hummingbirds are sleeker overall with a thinner neck than Anna's Hummingbirds. The male's dark purple gorget is limited to just the throat, whereas male Anna's have a red gorget and crown.

Female/immature.description: Female and immature Black-chinned and Anna's are difficult to separate. Black-chinned often appear more slender than Anna's. Most also have a clean throat, while some Anna's have a red spot on the throat.

Adult male.description: Adult male Costa’s Hummingbirds have a much deeper purple gorget that extends farther on the sides of the neck than the red gorget on male Anna's Hummingbirds.

Female.description: Female and immature Costa's Hummingbirds don't have central red feathers on the throat that most female/immature Anna's Hummingbirds have.

Female/immature.description: Female/immature Rufous Hummingbirds have cinnamon-washed sides, while female/immature Anna's have grayish green flanks.
